meanings.definition: The movement of an organism in response to light.
meanings.sent1: The phototaxies of the plant caused it to lean towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly's phototaxies guided it towards the bright flowers.
meanings.sent3: The phototaxies of the sunflower made it the envy of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her phototaxies towards positivity led her to always seek out the bright side of life.
meanings.sent5: The phototaxies of the firefly lit up the night with its mesmerizing dance.

meanings.definition: The orientation of an organism in response to light stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The bird's phototaxies helped it find the perfect spot to bask in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The fish's phototaxies allowed it to navigate through the clear waters effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The phototaxies of the cat made it a master at finding the sunniest napping spots.
meanings.sent4: His phototaxies were like a compass, always pointing him towards the brightest path.
meanings.sent5: The plant's phototaxies were so strong that it seemed to follow the sun across the sky.
